content: {knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-315-01-A |Item_parent=Acute leukaemia |Item_parent_short=Acute leukaemia |Rank=A |Title=Know the criteria defining acute leukemia (AL) |Description=None |Rubric=Definition |Contributors= |Order=1}} A clonal haematopoietic stem cell disease of the bone marrow resulting in proliferation and invasion of the bone marrow by immature, cancerous haematopoietic cells blocked at an early stage of differentiation: blasts. question.title: Definition of Acute Leukemia
question.description: A clonal haematopoietic stem cell disease of the bone marrow resulting in proliferation and invasion of the bone marrow by immature, cancerous haematopoietic cells blocked at an early stage of differentiation: blasts. By definition, these blasts represent more than 20% of the cells on cytological examination of the myelogram.

option_a.title: Acute leukemia is a type of blood cancer that occurs when the bone marrow produces too many mature white blood cells.
option_a.description: This option is a plausible but incorrect definition of acute leukemia.

option_b.title: Acute leukemia is a clonal haematopoietic stem cell disease of the bone marrow resulting in proliferation and invasion of the bone marrow by immature, cancerous haematopoietic cells blocked at an early stage of differentiation: blasts.
option_b.description: This option is a correct definition of acute leukemia.

option_c.title: Acute leukemia is a type of cancer that occurs when the bone marrow produces too many red blood cells.
option_c.description: This option is a plausible but incorrect definition of acute leukemia.

option_d.title: Acute leukemia is a type of blood cancer that occurs when the bone marrow produces too many platelets.
option_d.description: This option is a plausible but incorrect definition of acute leukemia.

correct_option.title: B
